instruction: Can the combination of Fourier transform infrared (FT-IR) spectroscopy and machine learning algorithms be considered a superior screening tool for breast cancer detection compared to traditional methods?
Output: The combination of Fourier transform infrared (FT-IR) spectroscopy and machine learning algorithms can be considered a superior screening tool for breast cancer detection compared to traditional methods. The past study showed that FT-IR spectroscopy, when combined with machine learning algorithms, was able to quickly and accurately distinguish patients with different stages of breast cancer from control subjects without breast cancer. The classification models used in past study achieved high average classification accuracies, ranging from 84.62% to 100%, depending on the stage of breast cancer. These results suggest that FT-IR spectroscopy, along with powerful classification algorithms, has great potential in improving the screening and diagnosis of breast cancer.
